ranked_diseases.explanation: Strong match with prominent fingertip pads (pathognomonic feature), intellectual disability, abnormal facial shape, clinodactyly, and feeding difficulties. IUGR and narrow palate are also consistent.
Similar phenotype to RTS1 with prominent fingertip pads, intellectual disability, and facial abnormalities. Caused by EP300 mutations rather than CREBBP.
Features intellectual disability, feeding difficulties, abnormal facial shape, and prominent fingertip pads. Horseshoe kidney and neonatal hypoglycemia can occur.
X-linked form of Kabuki syndrome with similar features including intellectual disability, feeding difficulties, and distinctive facial features.
Matches IUGR, feeding difficulties, intellectual disability, clinodactyly, and abnormal facial shape. Horseshoe kidney is rare but reported.
Features IUGR, intellectual disability, feeding difficulties, abnormal facial shape, and clinodactyly. Renal anomalies including horseshoe kidney can occur.
Can present with intellectual disability, feeding difficulties, abnormal facial features, and renal anomalies including horseshoe kidney.
Features feeding difficulties, intellectual disability, abnormal facial shape, and can have renal anomalies. Neonatal hypoglycemia possible with endocrine involvement.
